column4: Not easily.  Your packaging kung-fu would need to be very strong.
what tool should I be using ?
Why do you want to rebundle chromium?  Doing this could be a few hours of packaging work.
actually i want to rebundle amarok
Why do you want to rebundle Amarok?
i want to have it in one package so that i can use my previous packages of amarok.
You'll have dependency hell.  It won't work.  A better solution would be to compile the older Amarok for whatever libraries you have on the target computer.
Find the DSC file for the older version of Amarok that you want, use `dget` on it, and then do a `dpkg-buildpackage -us -uc`.   YMMV.
sorry to bother u again, should i dpkg.
No.  You need the development tools to build software packages.   Things like devscripts, build-essential, debhelper.
You'll probably need to go through the Debian packaging tutorial to get a working result.
i was thinking it will easy but doesn't seems to be.
An alternative is to put your old software into a virtual machine.
if you please tell me how i m suppose to do that.
